definition: to pick fault with/to spot the differences/to nitpick/to pick a quarrel/to find complaint with
to try to find/to look for/to call on sb/to find/to seek/to return/to give change
stubble land after crop has been taken/a second crop obtained by rotation of land/an opportunity

sentences.english: He’s been completely isolated by the other inmates and they just knock him around as he walks by.
sentences.chinese: 他完全被其它犯人孤立了，他走路都会有人找茬。

sentences.english: At this time, he may find stubble to lose his temper or show a ill-favored color.
sentences.chinese: 这时他也许找茬发一通脾气或摆出一副难看的脸色。

sentences.english: Her new boyfriend is a nit-picking lawyer.
sentences.chinese: 她现在的男朋友是个喜欢找茬儿的律师。

sentences.english: The fault finder will find faults even in paradise.
sentences.chinese: 人若爱找茬儿，天堂也能被他挑出毛病。

sentences.english: The fault-finder will faults even in paradise.
sentences.chinese: 人若爱找茬儿，天堂也能被他挑出毛病。

sentences.english: The heckler was ejected from the meeting.
sentences.chinese: 那个专找茬儿的捣蛋分子被逐出会场。

sentences.english: Rising above such cavilling and paying up would be a small step in itself.
sentences.chinese: 超越这种找茬和怨怨相报的心理本身将是一小步。

sentences.english: I just don't like people being bullied - picked on for no reason.
sentences.chinese: 我只是不喜欢有人被欺负，毫无理由地被找茬。

sentences.english: Starting today, anyone interested in giving the product a whirl can sign up.
sentences.chinese: 从今天起，任何想找茬的人都可以注册测试。

definition: to look for employment/to pick a quarrel
to pick a quarrel/to find fault/nitpicking
to look for bones in an egg/to find fault/to nitpick (idiom)
pinyin: ji1 dan4 li5 tiao1 gu3 tou5

definition: to disturb/to look for trouble/to stir up a row/to bother sb intentionally
to be hard on sb/to deliberately make things difficult
to pick a quarrel/to start a fight
to send punitive forces against/(fig.) to criticize violently
lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
to cause trouble/to create a disturbance
the guilty party files the suit/the thief cries thief
to bicker/to argue for the sake of arguing/to carry on poles (together with sb else)/to carry a coffin on poles
to tell on sb/to complain (to a teacher, a superior etc)/to bring a lawsuit
